question.title: Length of the Largest Subarray
question.content:
You are given ‘N’ distinct integers in the form of an array ‘ARR’. You need to print the length of the longest subarray in which the numbers are present in a continuous sequence.

Note: All elements are distinct from the array.

For example:
Let ‘ARR’ be: [1, 2, 4]
Then the largest subarray with continuous sequence will be: [1, 2]
So the length will be 2.
Input Format :
The first line of input contains an integer ‘T’, denoting the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains a single integer ‘N’, representing the size of the array.

The second line of each test case contains ‘N’ space-separated integers, representing the elements of the array ‘ARR’.
Output Format :
For each test case, print the length of the longest subarray having a continuous sequence.

Print output of each test case in a separate line.
Note :
You do not need to print anything. It has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints :
1 <= T <= 10
1 <= N <= 5*10^3
1 <= ARR[i] <= 10^9

Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1 :
2
3
1 3 2
3
1 4 2
Sample Output 1 :
3
1
Explanation For Sample Input 1 :
For test case 1: 
The whole array consists of continuous elements.
So the length is 3.

For test case 2: 
The largest subarray with continuous sequence will be [1] or [2] or [4].
So the length will be 1.
Sample Input 2 :
2
4 
14 12 11 20
3
10 12 11
Sample Output 2 :
2
3

rephrased.body: Given an array 'ARR' of 'N' distinct integers, find the length of the longest subarray where the numbers form a continuous sequence. A continuous sequence means the numbers are consecutive integers (e.g., [1, 2, 3] or [10, 11]).
constraints: 1 <= ARR[i] <= 10^9 (Value of each element in the array)

testcases.explanation: The array [1, 3, 2] can be rearranged to [1, 2, 3], which is a continuous sequence of length 3. Therefore, the longest continuous subarray is of length 3.
There are no subarrays longer than length 1 that form a continuous sequence. [1], [2], and [4] are the possible single-element subarrays, so the answer is 1.
The longest continuous sequence is [12, 11] after sorting which is of length 2.
The array can be rearranged to [10, 11, 12], which is a continuous sequence of length 3.
